Can you make a way for me to reproduce this please? So a simple series of steps to execute which will produce the error.

I tried to reproduce with S3 and some simple files with no success.

Also I really need to know which S3 compatible storage you are using!

If you could try to make this go wrong with a single text file and post the log with `-vv --dump bodies` that would be very useful (the contents of the text file will appear in the log).

I can reliably reproduce this with a single text file. "rclone cat ..." works fine for this file.

The file I used was a text file with the checksum of the rclone rpm package.

The S3 compatible storage is NetApp StorageGRID.

```
username@hostname:~$ cat rclone-v1.56.2-linux-amd64.rpm.md5
7da0413d7bada60ce72871d2cc201f45  rclone-v1.56.2-linux-amd64.rpm
```

```
username@hostname:~$ rclone cat src-test:/test/rclone-v1.56.2-linux-amd64.rpm.md5
7da0413d7bada60ce72871d2cc201f45  rclone-v1.56.2-linux-amd64.rpm
username@hostname:~$
```

I am not an S3 expert, but it looks like the HTTP responses are the same in both 1.56.2 and 1.55.1, so I see no obvious reason for the error - and doubt it is a general S3 error in 1.56.2.

Perhaps you already did, but otherwise I suggest you try to eliminate some of the other possibilities, E.g.:
* Do you see the same if you do the exact same copy from another S3 provider? (E.g. Amazon)
* Do you see the same if you do the exact same copy using another backend? (E.g. Google Drive)
* Do you see the same if you download a fresh rclone 1.56.2?
* Do you see the same if you use another computer?
* Do you see the same if you use another computer with another OS?

I do have the same problem. With rclone version v1.36 and v1.55.1 it works just fine while with v1.56.2 I get this error when I try to use the rclone copy command on a s3 bucket for some files:
`2021/10/26 12:37:02 ERROR : concours-1973-fileList.html: corrupted on transfer: sizes differ 0 vs 4216`

`rclone ls` lists the files correctly on all versions and I'm also able to copy other files but a few particular ones not.

Thanks @docuteam-kun, very good to know.

Please help us narrow down the root cause by posting the redacted output from these two commands:

    rclone version
    rclone config show yourS3remote:

This way we can see if it is related to a specific platform, S3 provider or general.

It would also be great to know if there seems to be a pattern/characteristic of failing files, and even better if you can make a test case that can be used to reproduce the issue at our end.
@olefrost @ncw I could possibly give access to the s3 storage I'm using to reproduce this. Let me know if that would help.

```
secret_access_key = XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
acl = private
access_key_id =XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX
type = s3
--------------------
```

A test case is not so easy. It happens to random files only and I can't share the particular files. But I'll try...

@docuteam-kun I was able to replicate this with a small text file containing the md5sum of rclone-v1.56.2-linux-amd64.rpm.

```
md5sum rclone-v1.56.2-linux-amd64.rpm > rclone-v1.56.2-linux-amd64.rpm.md5
rclone copy rclone-v1.56.2-linux-amd64.rpm.md5 remote:/path/
rclone copy remote:/path/rclone-v1.56.2-linux-amd64.rpm.md5 /local/path
```
